page.title: 06INDUSTRY IN AGHADOWEY
page.content: { Smyth Steel}is a large rural workshop where steel is fabricated for use mainly in{agriculture}and{building construction. Metals are imported from Great Britain, Spain, Sweden,Japan and South Africa. Its{products}are supplied to all parts of{Northern Ireland.}These include pig-feeders,pig-crates,calf- pens and other general steelwork for agriculture.Beams,girders and railings are supplied to the construction industry along with smaller items such as man hole covers and gullies. It was{established in 1979.}The workshop was built in the country to be close to the farming community. The size of the main building is 25m by 13m.The size of one of the extensions is 35m by 25m and the other 35m by 18m.The workshop employs{14 {workers.
